summary: Slikey, re: user being upset he responded
mainText: 'I replied because I see your point and I agree with you but wanted to provide context. Every voice in the community matters and I don't fault you for the comment. I saw it as a valid opinion to have.. Sorry for causing a pile up on you.ü´§'

summary: BuddhaCat, re: user appreciating honesty
Slikey, re: node graph world gen
mainText: 'The node graph on the modding blog post with the world generation result was real and functional - just that it is a prototype tool pending ingame integration. It will be fully usable on day 1 though.'

summary: Simon, re: two-handed weapons
mainText: 'Yes, not configured though.'

summary: Oscar, re: Reddoons' exclusive clip
mainText: 'Hol up, where did you get this clip?'

summary: Simon, re: lighting rendering
mainText:
'We are talking about lighting rendering, handled by client, which is C#
Server is Java (game boots a server when in single player)'

summary: Simon, re: user giving specific cave example and asking if it's possible
mainText: 'Yep.'

summary: Simon, re: Palworld Community Manager saying next couple weeks being huge for gamers
mainText: '2026 going to be a good year for gamers'

summary: Simon, re: user debating fully custom world or learn the Hytale tools
mainText: 'You can make prefabs, and spawn them in with worldgen! Mix of everything!'

summary: Simon, re: hot air balloon from trailer
mainText: 'Its on the long list if almost implemented; it wont make it in-game fully working. Same with grappling hook, lot of work to port them over. Focusing on critical stuff now that the clock is ticking!'

summary: Buddha, re: GamesRadar Hytale post
mainText: 'Ingenious marketing strategy? We‚Äôre just trying to be honest with our community and players üòÖ'

summary: Simon, re: Myne's statement on the red rock/dead coral biome
mainText: 'Havent seen it but can be remade in V2 easily'

summary: Slikey, re: pre-announcing Hardware Requirements post
mainText: 'Because it is not ready yet and I expect formatting / wordsmithing to be done by then. Also people like to record their reaction / stream it with their communities. We were asked by the community to announce posts ahead of time.'

summary: Slikey, re: Acorn wanting to know Slikey's specs
mainText: 'They are in the post :D I share my results in the creator part.'

summary: Slikey, re: user expressing their hopes for performance
mainText: 'You don't want to miss this one then :)'

summary: Propzie, re: Bigottina's Gaia art
mainText: 'You nailed Gaia from Hytale! Absolute art!'

summary: Simon, re: using WorldGen v2 for custom worlds
mainText: 'Yes'

summary: Slikey, re: server performance statistics
mainText: 'No, that will be covered in the game server provider / server owner manual.'

summary: Slikey announces Hardware Requirements to be shared tomorrow
mainText:
'Hardware Requirements for @Hytale will be released tomorrow, Monday, at 1pm EST / 6pm UTC. 

It will cover the minimum spec, recommended spec, creator recommendations and some deep dive into voxel sandbox specific technical factors.'

summary: Simon, re: GamesRadar article about Simon saying Hytale isn't good at the moment
mainText: 'bruh lol'

summary: Simon, re: YungNickYoung saying he'd mod Hytale day 1
mainText: 'Awesome! üòé'

summary: Simon, re: YungNickYoung
mainText:
'I hope he tries the new world gen ü§û
Would be insane to see what he can do with it!'

summary: Simon, re: difference btwn World Gen v2 and Minecraft mods
mainText: 'Artists can learn to use it, that‚Äôs the big difference üòé'

summary: Simon, re: world gen
mainText: 'Restrictions brings creative opportunities üòé'

summary: Simon, re: World Gen v2
mainText: 'We won't be able to launch much content using World Gen V2 on the early access launch, but you will see more and more content coming up using it after launch, so you can expand your explorations.'

summary: Simon, re: world gen pictures
mainText: 'This is old world gen.'

summary: Simon, re: separate World Gens
mainText: 'Separate things because they are very different. The new world gen will slowly be introduced before a big entrance later on; you will learn about it very soon.'

summary: Simon, re: World Gen blogpost
mainText: 'No ETA, early/mid Dec most likely. It's a big one and will define the future of Hytale, so we want to make sure it's done right.'

summary: Simon talks about World Gen v2
mainText:
'Everything shown in Hytale so far is World Gen v1, developed in 2017-2020.

Can't wait for you all to see what World Gen v2 is capable of, it's already being used in-game outside of the world you spawn in... we have not shown any of it, no screenshots or videos yet, soon you will see :)

As you know, I have been very honest about the game state, saying how it is and how not good it is. 
This time, no exaggeration: this new World Gen will redefine the block game genre.
Hytale might not be a good game yet, but that world gen v2 is years ahead of everything available. The potential is beyond imagination.

Everyone, even non-devs, will be able to edit World Gen v2. World Gen artists will be a thing. Blog post coming soon, it's a big one. Be prepared. We are putting the world's creations in the hands of creatives.'

summary: Simon, re: lighting
mainText: 'It's a top priority after all the critical issues on the render side are resolved.'
